titles.title: Mount Naomi Wilderness Boundary Adjustment Act
Mount Naomi Wilderness Boundary Adjustment Act
Mount Naomi Wilderness Boundary Adjustment Act
To make certain adjustments to the boundaries of the Mount Naomi Wilderness Area, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health Discharged.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-561.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 335.

action.text: Mr. Young (AK) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4870.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

bill.summary: 7/22/2002--Passed House amended. Mount Naomi Wilderness Boundary Adjustment Act - Adjusts the boundary of the Mount Naomi Wilderness to: (1) exclude the approximately 31 acres of land depicted on the Map as "Land Excluded;" and (2) include the approximately 31 acres of land depicted on the Map as "Land Added."
